message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.LG, cs.HC 

This paper deals with the problem of post-correction of OCR'ed historical printings using statistical profiles. It involves the use of lexica, pattern sets, and advanced matching techniques, which are commonly used in natural language processing and information retrieval, indicating that it could belong to the sub-categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL), information retrieval (cs.IR), and data mining (cs.DL). The paper also discusses the use of user feedback and adaptivity, which could fall under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) and human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
